title: couple speak joy after having
story: Couple speak of joy after having identical triplets at odds of up to  million to oneAlex and Amy Lindsay were left in total shock when they attended their -week appointment expecting to see one baby - only to learn there were three on the wayMum Amy Lindsay with the identical triplets and brothers Elijah, , and Zion,  Image: North News  Pictures Ltd northnewsByJeremy Armstrong:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA couple has spoken of their joy after having identical triplets - defying odds of up to  million to one. Alex and Amy Lindsay were left in apostotal shockapos when they attended their -week appointment expecting to see one baby -only to learn there were three on the way. The couple, who already had Elijah, , and two-year-old Zion, are now proud parents to five little boys. Estimates y, but experts believe the odds of having identical triplets are anything from one in ,, to one in m.Amy gave birth to Abel, Asher and Azariah in July at Sunderland Royal Hospital after  weeks of pregnancy. I felt really blessed, she said. It was a high risk pregnancy, but they all got to really good weights. However, it was very dficult by the end of my pregnancy. Even getting dressed was dficult and I was in pain just sitting down. Theyaposre very settled babies but the biggest challenge comes at feeding time when you’ve three babies all wanting to be fed at the same time. Iaposve been breast feeding them but have been topping it up with bottle feeds which also allows me to get support from Alex and my mother. Hubby Alex added: There’s always a risk when having triplets but they were all really healthy and a good weight.  Abel was lb , Asher lb  and Azariah lb . Amy, , recalled the shock of her first scan appointment, adding: Alex said he could see quite a lot of movement on the scan. Thataposs when the sonographer askedthere was a history of twins in the family and revealed there were two babies. We already have two little boys and so this was already a massive shock, I tried to calm myself down.  It was then the sonographer suddenly gasped – you could tell even behind the mask.The couple, of Houghton-le-Spring, Tyne and Wear, were concerned at first in case there was apossomething wrongapos. At that point I got quite emotional, added Amy. The plan was this would be our last child and with two boys under four, I wondered how we would cope. I just kept thinking, Iaposve only got two arms, how am I going to hold and feed them. Alex, , added: I remember telling my mother-in-law and she thought we were joking. She wouldn’t believe us until we showed her the scan. But we feel blessed. We are lucky we live in a four-bedroom detached house but space is an issue. Weaposve had to move out our dining table and chairs to make more room. aposMy friends keep joking that when the boys are older we can start our own five-a-side team. title: covid vaccine skin patch covered
story: Covid vaccine in skin patch covered in tiny needles created by British companyEmergex, a company from Oxfordshire, have created the patch, which is said to be more long-lasting than regular Covid vaccinations and is entering clinical trials soonThe company hopes that their patch will trigger a response that kills T cells, which could prevent the virus from even spreading Image: Latch MedicalByLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA Covid- vaccine administered through a skin patch covered in tiny needles could be on its way as the British invention enters the clinical trial stage. Emergex, a company from Oxfordshire, have created the patch, which is said to be more long-lasting than regular Covid vaccinations. The company hopes that their patch will trigger a response that kills T cells, which could prevent the virus from even spreading. Chief executive officer of Emergex and emeritus professor of molecular medicine at UCL Thomas Rademacher said: Our T cell priming vaccine for Covid has been specically designed to stimulate a T cell response to kill viral infected cells before they become factories for the virus.  The preclinical data we have suggests that our vaccine will elicit a strong T cell response similar to the longer lasting immune response that is found after many natural viral infections. Our vaccine is targeted to generate an immune response against highly conserved internal parts of the virus and potentially protect us against current and new iants and related strains of coronaviruses such as SARS-. The Emergex vaccine contains an antigen only found on the surface of infected cells.  This stimulates the immune system to activate a specic T cell that searches for cells with this protein on their surface and, when found, it hits the aposkill switchapos and destroys it. The vaccine is entering stage one clinical trials, which will see it administered to  people in Lausanne, Switzerland. If successful, it could be available by . Other companies are also developing Covid vaccines that are given through skin patches. In Australia, researchers are also testing one that contains , microneedles. title: crisp lovers baffled shop london
story: Crisp-lovers baffled as shop in London charges £. for a packet of CheetosA shop at Leicester Square Underground station in central London has been spotted selling the well-known American crisps Cheetos for an eye-watering price of £.The popular American crisp snack was being sold for £. at a shop by Leicester Square underground station Image: Moment Editorial Getty ImagesByRuaraidh GilmourRyan FaheyReporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Londoners are baffled after an Underground station shop was spotted charging customers £. for a packet of crisps.The Leicester Square tube station store is selling the well-known American crisps Cheetos for the excessive price. This comes as hungry Brits are currently unable to get their hands on Walkers crisps after the snack giant warned of shortages. And the issue was exacerbated by a fire breaking out at the Leicester factory.Social media users have found the exact same crisps being sold online for just £ including import charge. Some critics even say they found the crisps on sale for just £. in their own local stores.  One image shows three large bags of the g flaming hot Cheetos. The wrappers are orange and have the familiar cheetah mascot on the front. Stuck on to the front of the packet is a yellow sticker, labelling the confectionery at an eye-watering £..Alexander Jamal shared the price to Facebook on Sunday, writing: £ quid crisps.Whataposs it all about  Leicester Square tube. The Facebook post has received over  likes with over  comments from social media users appalled to see the price of the snack. Cary Choate commented: As an American, I can say they are not worth that.  Jo Parker said: Mad isnapost it. My son noticed that our off-licence in Essex sells the exact same thing for £. Michelle Karabut replied: Theyaposre £. where I live. Who wants them for a fiver including postage  Daniel Brown added: We went to a newsagent by Canon Street the other way that wanted £ for  Marlboro. We laughed and walked out. This is not the first extraordinarily priced product to have been spotted recently.Taking advantage of the supply disruption, some are peddling packets for up to £ being on eBay. Chancers are seizing on the lack of crisps from the manufacturer to bump up the prices online for people who canapost wait any longer.Crisp hoarders are selling packs of Walkers for around £ as the shortages continue and demand is high, reported the Daily Star. The online sellers are also offering iety boxes of Wotsits and Quavers on eBay for around £ that normally cost around £ from sold-out supermarkets. One eBay trader from Leicester, where Walkers crisps are originally from, is listing a .g pack of Walkers Salt  Vinegar crisps for £. that would usually cost about p. title: dj who never missed day
story: DJ who never missed a day dies two weeks after finding out he had cancerPhil Cheung, who was also known as DJ Chill, died aged  before doctors could determine what form of cancer he was facing, leaving his community devastatedPhil Cheung aka DJ Chill died two weeks after receiving the devastating diagnosisBySophie McLaughlin:,  Nov | commentsA much-loved and popular DJ died just two weeks after he was diagnosed with cancer. Phil Cheung, who was also known as DJ Chill, died before doctors could determine what form of cancer he was facing. He was  when he died after a short cancer battle, leaving his community aposdevastated.aposHis close friend Jackie Coade was at his side for his entire cancer journey and spoke to Belfast Live about the legacy he has left.She said: He was such a lovely person who was always thinking of other people - he did a lot of charity work and would have been involved in a lot of events through the Marketplace Theatre in Armagh, he was the DJ who always gave his time and would have never asked for anything in . Phil was a popular DJ in Northern Ireland as well as Ibiza and Liverpool, and had friends all over the world who have been left heartbroken by his sudden death - with big names such as Seb Fontaine taking a moment to pay their respects.  As well as being a highly respected DJ and figure in the music industry, Phil also worked for a company in Benburb doing accounts where he never missed a day and was fiercely dedicated to all he did. Jackie continued: He was amazing, absolutely amazing and we were so incredibly proud of him. As his friends, we knew how brilliant he was but when you read the comments people have made and who has made them shows how many people he touched. He had two weeks and four days from diagnosis to death, he didnapost even have time to get his head around it at all. Itaposs just so so tragic. There is a really important health message in all of this - pleaseyour body feels dferent oryou notice something wrong, I know the health service is under so much pressure at the moment, but please go get checked because Phil was always thinking of other people and didnapost want to take anything away from someone  who is really unwell. Jackie and Philaposs closest friends thanked the staff at Craigavon Area Hospital who cared for him in his final weeks and treated him like family despite the pressure they have been facing already this winter. The staff couldnapost have done more for him - they were truly outstanding even whilst under signicant pressure, they loved him so much and looked after him so well and we canapost thank them enough, she said. We canapost believe that we have had to organise a funeral for him, canapost comprehend it at all as he was only  years old and he was so young to only have two weeks and four days. Phil died before he was able to get the full diagnosis of what cancer he was fighting. He just didnapost have the time to get his head around this and even talking about it was making it real but we did try and keep it as positive as we could to keep him focused but sadly on Friday we got the call to say time was short. Weaposve had so many highs and lows over the last two weeks but he was so brave and fought it so hard and he really tried to keep a positive mind which was just him as he was always a very positive person and would have looked for the good in every situation and in every person.The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Sadly, Phil passed away very peacefully surrounded by love and with friends who told him how much we loved him and we made a promise that we would be there from the very beginning of this and he would never be on his own and he wasnapost - he slipped off very peacefully and we are so grateful for that. Philaposs friends organised a fundraiser after his death to cover funeral costs as the GoFundMe page states that he has no family left behind and they were able to reach their target after just one hour of the fundraising link being live - they intend to use the money to give him the send-off he truly deserved. Jackie added: We know there is messaging going out across Northern Ireland about AE or GPs being unable to see people but just keep pushing it and pushing it because there really is a lesson to be learnt here that you shouldnapost ignore your body and your health is just as important. He was just one of those very humble and quiet people who was larger than le in other ways. He was just an absolutely incredible human being that was so loved and weaposre just so sad heaposs not here. title: family torn apart after mum
story: Family torn apart after mum found dead one month after teenage son lost his leThe sister of a boy has slammed mental health services in her local area after her mother took her own le exactly a month after her sonJane Ireland was found dead at the family home in Lytham St Annes, Lancashire Image: LancsLive MENByAmy FentonKate BuckNews Reporter:,  Nov A heartbroken daughter has slammed her local mental health services after her mum and brother died exactly one month apart. Marshall Metcalfe, , died after suffering massive internal injuries after falling from a building on May , . Just a month later his mum Jane Ireland was found dead at the family home in Lytham St Annes, Lancashire. An inquest into both their deaths heard Marshall had suffered from schizophrenia and had retreated into himself after two spells in a mental health hospital. He had an extensive history with mental health, Senior Coroner Alan Wilson was told, which had began when he was  and would make himself sick over fears of gaining weight. Shortly before his death he was admitted to the The Cove - in-patient unit in Heysham run by Lancashire and South Cumbria NHS Foundation Trust, and told a therapist there that he intended to take his own le.But his sister Holly Ireland told inquest that she told staff at The Cove she had concerns about Marshall being discharged into his mumaposs care as she had her own mental health issues, but claimed those pleas were ignored. Miss Ireland, , said her mumaposs mental health deteriorated after she lost part of her nose when her then-partner assaulted her in . I was there when it happened, Miss Ireland told the inquest. It had a massive impact on her. She just couldnapost get her head round why he did it to her. I begged her to move away but she began to distance herself from her friends and started to communicate with angels. She relied on his family when he was in prison for what he did to her. She had no nose, she had to go through so many operations, and she found it so hard just walking through the streets looking like that. During a four month stay at The Cove in May , Miss Ireland said he was simply drugged up and not given any therapy. He absolutely hated it in there, Miss Ireland said. There was only one person in there who could get down on his level. He shut himself off to everybody he was really poorly. I was constantly ringing The Cove but would a doctor speak to me  No. Miss Ireland said her worries about her mum were ignored before Marshall was discharged into her care. By Christmas  Marshall wasnapost there at all and his mum had begun to hear voices telling her to kill herself, Miss Ireland added. Mum was very good at hiding her illness but she was really unwell and she wasnapost getting any help, she said. At one point we were driving to somewhere for something to eat and she was just screaming and shouting in the back of the car. She said she was hearing voices telling her she was disgusting and she was screaming aposleave me aloneapos. In January  Marshall was admitted to hospital after he stopped eating and drinking. Miss Ireland said this was the worst she had seen her brother and said it was like he was not on this planet. In February  he was once more admitted to The Cove despite his familyaposs concerns that the unit had failed to help him in the past.  They just drugged him up, he didnapost have any therapy, but he was sectioned so it was like we didnapost have a voice, Miss Ireland said. I fought so hard to save them both but theyaposre not here anymore. The Cove turned him into a zombie. A post mortem revealed Marshall died as a result of a a number of injuries including broken ribs and signicant blood loss. Despite efforts to save him, Marshall was pronounced dead after reaching the hospital. One of Janeaposs friends, Russell Wilding, was with her shortly after she was informed Marshall had died. It was absolutely horrendous, Mr Wilding told the inquest. She was like a wounded animal. Iaposve never seen anyone in that much pain. In a statement, Janeaposs mum Patricia Ireland described her daughter as a talented make-up artist and reiki healer, as the apple of her father Benjaminaposs eye. She was so kind and generous and full of le, Mrs Ireland said. After Marshallaposs death the voices in Janeaposs head became meaner, Patricia said, and on June , one month after her son died, Jane was found dead in bed at her home. Mr Wilding, who discovered her body, said in a statement: I hadnapost been able to get hold of her so I went round. The front door was locked so I went round the back and the back door was wide open. That wasnapost unusual as she would often sit in the garden. But as I went up the stairs I started to feel that something was wrong. I miss Jane terribly she was a wonderful person. Post mortem toxicology tests revealed Miss Ireland had fatal levels of methadone in her system which caused her death. The inquest, which is due to last two weeks, continues on Tuesday. The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. limitcontent_window_hourssorted_bytotal_visible_contents,ozoneDisplayPrebidEnabled:true,nativeAppBanner:true,ixDisplayPrebidEnabled:true,commentCountEnabled:true,lotameMantisDisabled:,video.imaVersion:.,videoPrebidEnabled:true,video.suppressDates:true,delayVideoAdsUntilConsented:true,fbia.chartbeat.inbody:,appNexusVideoPrebidEnabled:true,parentUrl:https:www.mirror news uk-news hero-liverpool-cab-driver-prevented-"Liverpool Women’s Hospital: Police give statement following incidentByLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov A hero taxi driver prevented an awful disaster by locking a suspicious passenger in his cab before the vehicle blew up. Quick-thinking David Perry heroically prevented more bloodshed, but was injured himself, following the potential Poppy Day terror attack.His male passenger died after the cab exploded outside Liverpool Womenaposs hospital - Europeaposs largest maternity hospital - on Sunday morning. Mr Perry was standing near the blast which happened seconds before the am minuteaposs Remembrance Day silence was about to begin. He is claimed to have suffered cuts, bruises and damage to his ear drum.Have you been affected by this story  Get in touch at webnews@mirror Mayor of Liverpool Joanne Anderson told BBC Radio aposs Today programme that David had erted a disaster with his heroic action.She said: The taxi driver with his heroic efforts has managed to ert what could’ve been an absolutely awful disaster at the hospital, our thanks go to him. Reports claim Mr Perryaposs male passenger had asked to go to the cityaposs Service of Remembrance before dying in the blast.  Following the explosion anti-terror police carried out several raids across Liverpool and three men - aged , , and  - were detained in the Kensington area of the city and arrested under the Terrorism Act in connection with the incident. A number of locals said armed officers swooped on a terraced house in the afternoon. Dozens of homes have also been evacuated in an operation that is still ongoing on Monday morning.  A source who is close to Mr Perryaposs family told MailOnline that his brave actions has potentially saved lives. They claimed Mr Perry - who has been described as an experienced cab driver - picked up the passenger who initially asked to be dropped off at Liverpoolaposs Anglican Cathedral which is half a mile from the hospital. A Remembrance Sunday parade had just ended and a memorial event featuring thousands of servicemen, veterans and dignitaries was being held at the church.  But the source claimed the route had to be changed due to road closures so the man asked to be dropped off at the centre centre before Mr Perry became suspicious as they drove past the hospital. They said Mr Perry noticed some kind of light attached to his clothing and the man was messing around with it which is when he jumped out of his car and locked the passenger in the back of the vehicle. They said: As soon as he did, itaposs gone off. Davidaposs the luckiest man in Britain as well as the most heroic,this guy got in the hospital God knows what could have happened. Counter-terrorism police said they continue to keep an open mind about the cause of the explosion and are working closely with Merseyside Police. A fundraiser which was set up to support Mr Perry and his family has raised more than £, in just a few hours.  Among those paying tribute to the hero cab driver was Billy Darwin.He posted on Facebook : “David nearly paid the ultimate price to save others apparently not giving anything a second thought besides making sure he went above and beyond to keep the people of Our City safe!”Kev Cuthbertson posted: “He is a hero, when he noticed the bomb, he locked the scumbag in the car. But took the brunt of the blast.”  Stephen Thomas wrote: “The driver is my mate, and spotted the passenger acting suspiciously, so he jumped out the car.” Another, George Cater, wrote: Please send your healing prayers to David Perry, the very brave taxi driver who is in a critical condition in hospital after preventing an attack at am this morning at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital. David stopped by the women’s hospital and locked the attacker in his cab after noticing the device.Prime Minister Boris Johnson said it appears the taxi driver caught up in the Liverpool explosion acted with “incredible presence of mind and bravery”. He also tweeted on Sunday: My thoughts are with all those affected by the awful incident in Liverpool today.I want to thank the emergency services for their quick response and professionalism, and the police for their ongoing work on the investigation.  Earlier, a spokesman for Merseyside Police said: So far we understand that the car involved was a taxi which pulled up at the hospital shortly before the explosion occurred. We are keeping an open mind as to what caused the explosion, but given how it has happened - out of caution - counter terrorism police are leading the investigation supported by Merseyside Police. The Chief Constable of Merseyside Police, Serena Kennedy, has offered her reassurance over the incident.  She said: While I understand that todayaposs incident may cause concern in our communities, it should be pointed out that events of this nature are very rare. Merseyside Police will continue to liaise with community groups, community leaders, partner agencies and iniduals in the coming days and weeks to make sure any concerns are addressed and ensuring that we provide the best possible service to local people.  There will also be an increased and visible police presence on the streets of Merseyside and I would encourage people to engage with my officers and raise any concerns they may have. Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital said visiting access had been restricted until further notice and patients had been erted to other hospitals where possible.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Merseyside PoliceTerrorismTerror attacks" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: human ken doll reality tv
story: Human Ken Doll and reality TV wannabe jailed after showing lack of respect for the lawJimmy Featherstones failure to comply with court orders caught up with him and he was sentenced to time in custody for his flagrant disrespect for the courtsThe aspiring reality TV star, real name Jimmy Featherstone, appeared at Hull Magistrates Court Image: Hull LiveByGregory Ford:,  Nov | commentsA real-le Ken Doll has been jailed after he repeatedly refused to comply with court orders and was accused of showing aposa lack of respectapos. Aspiring reality TV star Jimmy Featherstone, appeared at Hull Magistratesapos Court on Monday, charged with failing to comply with the requirements of a community order.Featherstone, , has been bound by two court orders made in relation to matters heard in court in May  and in April this year, reports Hull Live.He is known locally as an eccentric tanning addict and aspiring TV personality who claimed to have spent £, a year on his plastic surgery obsession, the site adds.  The court heard Featherstone had repeatedly breached his community order having been offered  office appointments by the probation service, only attending six. The defendant still had  days of uncompleted rehabilitation work when he came before the court on Monday accused of non-compliance with the community order. The court was told he had spoken to his designated offender manager in an aposunacceptable wayapos when he was questioned about his most recent absence at the start of this month.  Defence solicitor Mr Vining told the court in mitigation that Featherstone had told him he had dficulty remembering appointments and had bought himself a diary to assist with those problems. District Judge Passfield questioned the mitigation, asking Mr Vining: I would assume that he has a phone, does he not have one with a calendar  Featherstone accepted the charge of breaching the latest court order and Mr Vining admitted his client was absolutely terried of going to prison.  He said: He is intending to pursue a career in reality TV and says that he would be in a position to pay a financial penaltythe court was minded that would be sufficient. He is absolutely terried by the prospect of a prison sentence and feels that his appearance would leave him vulnerable while he is in custody. He tells me that he has been the victim of attacks in public in and around Hull city centre just for the way that he looks and with homophobic undertones.  However, District Judge Passfield said: Mr Featherstone, it is abundantly clear to me that you do not feel bound to the orders made by this court. You have shown a complete lack of respect after you were given a conditional discharge in May  which you have continued to breach on multiple occasions. Revisiting your sentencing, I am today giving you an eight week custodial sentence for both offences, you will serve these concurrently and will spend eight weeks in prison in total. title: kate middleton pays tribute diana
story: Kate Middleton pays tribute to Diana and Queen with Remembrance Sunday hatKate Middleton paid a subtle tribute to her late mother-in-law Princess Diana at the Festival of Remembrance and then during the Remembrance Sunday ceremony the following dayThe Duchess of Cambridge on the balcony at the Remembrance Sunday service at the Cenotaph Image: PAByJenner NewtonRoyal Features WriterWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsKate Middleton appeared to pay tribute to the Queen and Princess Diana at Sundayaposs Remembrance Day service with her choice of hat, an expert says. On Saturday she attended the Royal British Legionaposs annual Festival of Remembrance at the Royal Albert Hall before watching the National Service of Remembrance at the Cenotaph in Central London on Sunday morning. At both events, she paid a subtle tribute to her late mother-in-law Diana by wearing some of her jewellery. On Saturday night, she wore Dianaaposs Collingwood pearl earrings that were given to the late princess as a wedding gt in . She also wore Dianaaposs three-strand pearl bracelet, which the late princess acquired in . Kate had previously worn the bracelet during a tour of Germany in .  And on Sunday, she again wore the Collingwood pearl earrings along with an Alexander McQueen coat that had poppies pinned to it. But it was the choice of hat that drew comparisons to a similar outfit worn by Princess Diana at a previous event, as well as possible similarities to the Queen. People reports that the hat was speculated by Elizabeth Holmes, author of HRH: So Many Thoughts on Royal Style , to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth, whose wide-brimmed hats are a staple of her wardrobe.Kate looked solemn as she stood in the middle with Camilla and Sophie at her sides on a balcony of the Foreign Office while Prince Charles, Prince William, Princess Anne and Prince Edward were below as they laid wreaths at the Cenotaph. However, missing from the balcony was the Queen, who had sprained her back and was unable to attend the Remembrance Sunday service. In previous years, the Queen had stood on the balcony at the centre of Kate and Camilla. Buckingham Palace had said Her Majesty was disappointed to miss the event held annually at the Cenotaph on Whitehall. news uk-news liverpool-bomber-wanted-cause-maximum-"Liverpool: CCTV captures moment taxi explodes at hospitalByChris HughesDefence and Security EditorNick SommerladInvestigations EditorPaul ByrneLucy ThorntonHollie Bone:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Liverpool taxi bomber Emad Al Swealmeen wanted to cause death and mayhem at a maternity ­hospital packed with women and babies, terror experts fear. The -year-old Syrian refugee’s murderous mission was thwarted by heroic cabbie David Perry, who is said to have locked him in the vehicle as he detonated his home-made device. It is also feared the type of bomb he used could indicate that an al-Qaeda cell was involved, as the country’s terror threat alert was raised from substantial to severe – meaning another attack is now “highly likely”. Al Swealmeen is believed to have had mental health problems and according to pals had been sectioned for brandishing a kne in the city centre before launching his death bid.  And it was tonight reported his intended Remembrance Day target was church-goers who helped him convert from Islam to Christianity. But police said he switched his deadly intentions to Liverpool Women’s Hospital after his route in a taxi was blocked by traffic and road closures and told David to head there. A senior former intelligence source said: “The bomber intended to enter the hospital and trigger his device, but for some reason it went off early and failed properly to initiate.  “Had he successfully set off the bomb inside it would have been extremely bloody and horric. “We believe this was a partial ­explosion, clearly from a device at high-chest level, aimed at causing many casualties.” Al Swealmeen, who died inside the burning cab, converted from Islam in Liverpool’s Anglican ­cathedral in March . He spent eight months living with devoted Christians Malcolm and ­Elizabeth ­Hitchcott at their home in the Aigburth district.  The couple today told of their shock at hearing the “quiet and well mannered” man, who was also quite artistic, allegedly intended to bomb women and children. Former soldier Mr Hitchcott­ said: “It’s terribly sad. We loved him. He was a lovely guy and we are shocked. “We are shocked because a less likely ­candidate you could not imagine.  “He first came to the ­cathedral in August  and wanted to convert to ­Christianity. He was ­destitute at that time and we took him in.” Mr and Mrs Hitchcott told how Al Swealmeen arrived in the UK via Dubai in  seeking asylum. It is believed his case had been decided and rejected at first. Motor racing fan Al Swealmeen, who is said to have called himself Enzo Almeni after Ferrari founder Enzo Ferrari, then renewed his ­application in November .  But the couple said he never spoke about his time in Syria or Iraq. They said he was born in Iraq where his mum was from. His dad was Syrian. Armed police arrested three men in Kensington, a mile from the blast, on Sunday at .pm. They are aged ,  and . A fourth aged  was held today close to Sefton Park. ­Neighbours told of the drama as officers raided the property. One policeman could be seen with a gun on a ladder overlooking a garden behind the raided terraced house. There was a shout of “armed police” and another officer appears to break down the wooden fence or gate before storming the garden. A man in a white T-shirt looked through the back door, before ­disappearing. There were then shouts of “get out of the house, do not move, hands on your head now” as the man re-emerges and follows instructions to lie on the ground.  Resident Keith Ford, , said: “Police were everywhere. There were two officers with big guns, they looked like machine guns, pointed at the house. “One of them must have come to the door as I heard the policeman say to him, ‘Hands in the air’. “But he must have refused and gone back into the house because I then heard the policeman say, ‘He might have a gun in his pocket.’”  Matthew Heitman, , who lives opposite the raided house, added: “Two of the men were marched out at gunpoint and they had them up against the wall. There wasn’t any kind of struggle, they just walked out. “The people living there had not long moved in.” Jimmy Ashworth, , who runs Jimmy’s cafe was evacuated at am today as the further arrest took place.  He said: “They said that my le was in danger, that’s all they could tell me.” Photographs taken within the cordoned area at am showed a man in a black puffer jacket, black ­trousers and white trainers being held. One -year-old ­resident, who gave her name as Amy, said: “It’s unbelievable to think we were living  yards away from a bomb factory. I haven’t slept all night.”  Today Army specialists carried out a controlled explosion near Sefton Park “as part of the ongoing” probe into the blast, according to police. There have been warnings for weeks that terror groups are growing in Afghanistan following the bungled evacuation and could attack the West. The intelligence source added: “This is the attack we have been warning would take place.  “We are likely to see more in the coming months. Terrorists globally have been given confidence since the Afghan ­withdrawal and they have more space and time to devote to extending their violence worldwide.” Boris Johnson slammed the ­“sickening attack.” The PM said: “My thoughts remain with all those affected and I want to pay tribute to the emergency services who responded as always with such speed and professionalism.  “The British people will never be cowed by terrorism.” The Liverpool attack came just two weeks after Tory MP David Amess was stabbed to death at his surgery in an alleged terror incident. Home Secretary Priti Patel said the terror threat has been raised because “what we saw yesterday is the second incident in a month”.  NHS chiefs have ordered an overhaul of security at hospitals across England’s  health trusts. Cab driver David fled the vehicle after the explosion and just moments before it was engulfed in flames. He was treated in hospital.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Terror attacksTerrorismPolitics" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: liverpool bomb suspect converted christianity
story: Liverpool bomb suspect converted to Christianity at cathedral he wanted to attackEmad Al Swealmeen, , who died when an improvised explosive device went off at just before am on Remembrance Sunday, reportedly came to the UK from IraqEmad Al Swealmeen was named by counter terror authorities tonightByLucy ThorntonJonathan ColesNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov This is the first picture of the man suspected of detonating a bomb outside a hospital in Liverpool on Remembrance Sunday. Emad Al Swealmeen, , died when an improvised explosive device went off in a taxi at just before am, police believe. He was named by the authorities on Monday - as it emerged he may have converted to Christianity after arriving in Britain. Reports claimed Al Swealmeen, a Syrian asylum seeker, also went by the name Enzo Almeni. It is claimed he suffered from mental health problems and had a previous conviction for carrying a kne - but was not known to MI.Do you know Emad Al Swealmeen  Email webnews@mirror.Searches are under way at addresses on Rutland Avenue and Sutclfe Street, where officers say Al Swealmeen previously lived at. Signicant items have been recovered, counter-terror police said.According to MailOnline, Al Swealmeen is believed to have spent a large part of his le in Iraq, where his mother came from.He then changed his name in honour of Ferrari founder Enzo Ferrari and to apossound less Muslimapos in a bid to help his asylum application. Malcolm Hitchcott told the website that he first met Al Swealmeen in , who later moved in with him and his we.  He said the suspect was confirmed as a Christian by at least March , adding that he was destitute at that time. The Mail adds that he wanted to attack Liverpoolaposs Anglican Cathedral where hundreds had gathered to attend a Remembrance Day service. He first came to the cathedral in August  and wanted to convert to Christianity, Mr Hitchcott told the Mail. He took an Alpha course, which explains the Christian faith, and completed it in November of that year. That enabled him to come to an informed decision. But police said Al Swealmeen switched his deadly intentions to Liverpool Women’s Hospital after his route in a taxi was blocked by traffic and road closures - and told the driver to head there.  A senior former intelligence source said: “The bomber intended to enter the hospital and trigger his device, but for some reason it went off early and failed properly to initiate. “Had he successfully set off the bomb inside it would have been extremely bloody and horric. “We believe this was a partial ­explosion, clearly from a device at high-chest level, aimed at causing many casualties.” Naming the suspect this evening Det Chf Insp Andrew Meeks, from Counter-Terrorism Policing North West, said: aposaposOur enquiries are very much ongoing but at this stage we strongly believe that the deceased is  year old Emad Al Swealmeen. Al Swealmeen is connected to both the Rutland Avenue and Sutclfe Street addresses where searches are still ongoing. We believe he lived at the Sutclfe Street address for some time and had recently rented the Rutland Avenue address. Our focus is the Rutland Avenue address where we have continued to recover signicant items.  We continue to appeal for any information about this incident and now that we have released his name any information that the public may have about Al Swealmeen no matter how small may be of great assistance to us.aposapos So far four men have been arrested under terrorism laws in the Kensington area of Liverpool in connection with the attack. Three suspects aged ,  and , who were held on Sunday, and a man aged , who was detained a day later. A controlled explosion was also carried out on Monday in Sefton Park as a precaution as part of the investigation, police said. The blast outside of Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital has been declared a terrorist attack by authorities, who say they are yet to establish a motive. The UKaposs threat level has been raised to severe, meaning an attack is highly likely. Speaking at a press conference at Downing Street, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said the blast was a stark reminder to the public to remain vigilant, adding: What yesterday showed above all is that the British people will never be cowed by terrorism, we will never give in to those who seek to ide us with senseless acts of violence. And our freedoms and our way of le will always prevail.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Remembrance DayMIHospitalsMental healthTerrorism" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news magnicent-seven-senior-royals-queens-"Royal duty will transition away from Queen says BondByRussell MyersRoyal editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsSenior royals have vowed to step in and help with the Queen’s diary “for as long as is needed”, as courtiers are set to scale down the monarch’s engagements until the spring, sources have revealed. Her Majesty is continuing to rest at Windsor Castle after she was forced to pull out of attending the Remembrance Sunday service at the Cenotaph. Buckingham Palace moved to dampen fears over her condition after announcing the -year-old had suffered an “unfortunate” back strain, which left her “deeply disappointed” to miss the event. Courtiers are now understood to now be taking a “cautious approach” with the sovereign’s diary moving forward, with no public engagements expected for the rest of the year. Insiders with knowledge of the conversations said there should be a “realistic expectation” that the Queen’s diary will be dramatically reduced throughout the winter months. Any rearranging could open up the possibility of asking any one of the seven senior royals to step in and take on extra roles or engagements. Prince Charles, the Duchess of Cornwall, Prince William, the Duchess of Cambridge, Princess Anne and Prince Edward and his we Sophie are all understood to be aligned on helping out “for as long as is needed”.  Courtiers have said this “joined up approach” will take on “extra signicance” in the Queen’s absence leading up to her Platinum Jubilee next year. Somewhat tongue in cheek, palace officials have dubbed them the “Magnicent Seven” when referring to the group. Palace officials have insisted the Queen has “no intention of stepping back” from royal duties but realises she will undertake less duties in the future.  The Queen has been on doctors’ orders to rest for nearly a month after being admitted to hospital for preliminary investigations - her first overnight stay in a medical facility in eight years - on October .One royal source said: “The Queen remains as sharp as a pin, but the reality is she needs to take a period of rest following an extremely busy start to normal duties after the coronavirus -gtcoronavirus restrictions were lted.“The senior members of the family are all aligned in that they will be available to help out wherever they can and for as long as is needed.”Earlier this year after the furore over Prince Harry and his we Meghan’s split from The Firm the Queen vowed a “new beginning” for the royals after the Duke and Duchess of Sussex chose mega-money deals over duty.At the time Her Majesty, , gave the go-ahead for the seven senior royals to take up public engagements as soon as possible. The Prince of Wales, Duke of Cambridge and Princess Royal have in recent times taken on investitures on behalf of the Queen, handing out gongs at Buckingham Palace or Windsor Castle.  Apart from awarding fundraising and war veteran hero Sir Captain Tom Moore his knighthood last summer at Windsor Castle, the Queen’s last investiture was at Buckingham Palace in November , when she awarded honours to more than  people. A palace spokesman said the Queen would continue to undertake “light duties” while recovering from her bad back and is due to carry out virtual audiences in a few days’ time. The Queen also has cancelled a scheduled appearance on Tuesday at the General Synod - the first time the Queen, who is Supreme Governor of the Church of England, has missed her five-yearly visit to the Church’s national assembly in its -year history. As she continues to take it easy this week, the coming weekend marks a dficult milestone for the Queen. Saturday would have been the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh’s th wedding anniversary - and it will be the first anniversary of their marriage to pass since Philip died in April at the age of . A source said: “The Queen has been and continues to be hugely comforted by many of her family rallying round this year and will no doubt be looking forward to being together for Christmas this year.”Charles and Camilla’s Middle East tour Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall will kick off their tour of Jordan and Egypt on Tuesday. It will be the first overseas visit by a senior royal family member since the pandemic began. They will arrive in Jordan’s capital Amman and meet King Abdullah II and Queen Rania to mark the country’s centenary and its relationship with Britain.  Charles, , will highlight the nation’s role in sheltering , Syrian refugees and two million Palestinians. Camilla is to learn about the work of Queen Rania in helping the vulnerable and take part in a Women of the World event. The tour coincides with the end of Britain’s hosting of COP and Egypt’s nomination to stage the UN climate summit next year. The royals will meet President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and the Grand Imam of Egypt’s al-Azhar and also celebrate Britain’s links with the country. A reception will be staged overlooking the pyramids at the Giza Plateau. The royal couple will also tour the ancient city of Alexandria. They are to have talks about religious tolerance and the role of faith in environmental issues. title: penny pinching headteacher one many
story: Penny-pinching headteacher one of many who care more for numbers than hungry kidsHeadteacher Neil Foden, who ordered his school cook not to feed kidstheir meal accounts were p in arrears, writes Darren Lewis Childrens welfare always comes before balance sheets and every teacher should know thatNeil Foden warned parents their children would not be fedthere was a debt on their school meal accountopinionByDarren Lewis:,  Nov | commentsPenny-pinching ­jobsworths like Neil Foden exist in businesses and schools everywhere. They are the kind of people for whom numbers, and not humanity, remain the bottom line. Foden is the headteacher who ordered the cook at his school in Gwynedd, North Wales, not to feed kidstheir meal accounts are even p in arrears.“The school has been instructed not to give food to any child from November their debt has not been cleared, or, in the future, to children whose accounts do not have enough money to pay for lunch,” read a letter to parents.Their debt  They are children, for goodness’ sake. Debt shouldn’t be a word they even know in a school context.In any case, how on earth can you be a teacher and not believe kids have a basic right to eat Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section With suggestions that some staff were storing food in their classrooms for hungry kids, it appears not all of Foden’s colleagues were on board.Before his school’s board u-turn and apology this afternoon, Foden had sought to defend his ­Dickensian approach, maintaining he’d taken action because “a handful of pupils had run up debts totalling more than £,”. “We’re not talking about cracking down excessively harshly on a handful of parents who’ve run up debts of a fiver or so,” he said.Trouble is, it didn’t take long for reporters to find one parent who’d been contacted by the local authority after being overdrawn to the tune of just p. Doubtless there’ll be others. Why not just send a letter out to families to distinguish between those dragging their heels and those who really are on hard times  Why not then point those in need towards the ways to apply for emergency school meals in Wales  You’d like to think Foden is more embarrassed by his ruthless words in the cold light of day than the ferocious social media backlash towards his leaked letter.He should certainly be ashamed that a blogger, Simon Harris of the Men Behaving Dadly podcast, even offered to pay the £, – even though he doesn’t have a child there.Either way, maybe it is Foden who qualies for an early visit from the Ghost of Christmas Past. title: uk weather forecast exact date
story: UK weather forecast: Exact date snow to hit as expert warns of little ice ageThe November weather has been unseasonably mild so far in the UK, but temperatures are expected to fall to -C within days and a forecaster has warned of widespread snowThe UK is set for freezing temperatures by the end of November Image: Getty ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsBrits are set to enjoy another week of mild weather before temperatures plunge to around -C next week with another spell of snow. So far it has been an unseasonably mild November where people have been able to bask in outbreaks of sunshine around the country and little will change over the coming days. But by the end of next weekend the temperatures will start to fall as freezing Arctic winds take a grip bringing sub-zero temperatures. WXCharts show the mercury could drop as low as -C to -C during the week of November  with the frostiest conditions in the far north of Scotland. Scotland is likely to see snowfall from Sunday, the agency predicted.  Snow is expected to start from November  in the Grampians and the Highlands before moving down the country over the coming days and by the end of the month it is likely to cover parts of northern England and North Wales. There is a chance that as far south as Brighton could have sub zero temperatures by November  according to the weather maps. Then from then onwards there is a risk of snow and ice across the country.Oliver Claydon, Met Office, told the Express : “Long-lead models are showing there is a chance for things to turn a bit colder in the middle of next week.“Uncertainty is hinged around an area of high pressure,it’s further to the west then it could pull a chance of snow from the north. Snow is likely to continue after next week and temperatures will get colder as the month goes on.James Madden, forecaster for Exact Weather, told the Express : “The cold is likely to win out before the end of November bringing an early taste of winter and the risk of snow.“Waning solar activity means chances are high for a aposlittle ice ageapos winter this year with notable periods of cold and snow. “We have high confidence for the most cold and wintry conditions since December  developing towards the end of the year. That could bring extreme cold temperatures and spells of widespread snow, he added.Met Office five-day weather forecast Tuesday Mostly cloudy start across England and Wales with possible drizzle, and patchy thick fog in the east and south. Sunnier breaks further north and west, before Scotland and Northern Ireland see rain followed by blustery, heavy showers. Windy and colder. Tuesday night Weakening rain band crossing southern UK followed by clearer conditions. Further north, blustery showers, some heavy, especially for northern and western Scotland, wintry on higher hills. Windy and chilly here. Wednesday Showers in northern and western areas will slowly ease, although replaced by evening rain in northwest UK. Further south, a mainly dry day with sunny spells. Somewhat cooler and breezier. Thursday to Saturday Most regions dry and very mild with iable, often large amounts of cloud. Rain across the far northwest sinking further south on Saturday and turning colder from the north. title: woman council flat riddled big
story: Woman in council flat riddled with big black mould too embarrassed to invite people overCourtney Simcox acts as a full time carer for her dad, and says she feels "trapped" by her situation and is now lives in her living room because of the black mould which covers her homeA full time carer says shes too embarrassed to have family or friends over to visit because of an outbreak of mould which riddles her council flat Image: BPM MEDIAByJamie BrassingtonKate BuckNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA full time carer says sheaposs too embarrassed to have family or friends over to visit because of an outbreak of mould which has riddled her council flat.Courtney Simcox moved into the social housing provided by Trident Group in June, and says the fungus now covers her walls, ceilings and floors.The -year-old from Tipton says sheaposs been forced to live in her living room because of the black mould, which is also taking its toll on her mental health.Miss Simcox, who is a full time carer for her dad, told Birmingham Live that the the mould first appeared around a month after she moved in, but was able to be cleaned away with some mould and mildew spray. However, it reappeared in October has become really bad. She said: There is loads and loads of mould. It is like big, black mould. It is in my bedroom, all over my bedroom walls and the window sill, all over the windows, the ceiling and the floor. It got into my chest of drawers so I had to throw them away. It is in my kitchen, above my window. I suffer with severe depression. I cannot have my friends and my family around because I am embarrassed - I am currently living in my living room.  It is embarrassing and it is making my depression worse. Miss Simcox currently doesnapost have much of a choice in trying to leave due to her financial situation, and is currently on careraposs allowance and universal credit. It is making my le a misery, I am trapped, she said. Because I am on benefits, and I donapost get a lot, it isnapost like I can find myself somewhere new. I donapost want to be there anymore. Theyhavenapost helped me.  I just want to move. But I donapost want this to happen to anyone  because it isnapost right. It is like they donapost want to help. The council have told her the reason for the mould is caused by her not opening her windows, Miss Simcox claims. But she says she is reluctant to open the windows as there are bins directly outside which then cause the inside of the home to smell. My housing officer said it is due to not having the windows open, she told Birmingham Live. But I canapost open the windows because there are bins literally right outside my bedroom window. It doesnapost smell too good. In response to the story, a spokesperson for Trident Group said: We take the health and wellbeing of all our residents seriously and all our properties, prior to being let, are inspected by the organisation and a third party. We will investigate all concerns raised and work with residents to resolving any issues arising as soon as possible. Comment MORE ON Housing" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman spat over babys face
story: Woman spat all over babys face then abused mum of three at bus stopA mum claims she was waiting for a bus with her children when the stranger flew into a fit of rage and has left her having panic attacksRachel Holden, , said she and her family were attacked in an unprovoked incident in Rock Ferry on Saturday Image: Liverpool ECHOByAnnie Williams:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA woman claims she and her children were assaulted by a stranger whilst “minding their own business” on a family day out. Rachel Holden was waiting for a bus in Rock Ferry, Wirral, with her three children on November  when she claims a woman “spat all over” her baby who was sitting in a pram and attacked the mum-of-three.The -year-old was sat in the bus stop on Old Chester Road by Lidl at around .am when she said a stranger began to get both verbally and physically abusive to the family, reports the Liverpool Echo.Rachel said: “I had booked tickets for me and the kids to go to Monkey Business in Bromborough so we were on our way to get the bus. “We got to the bus stop and the boys sat on the bench - I said to the boys the bus is going to be  minutes and we all groaned jokingly. “This women stood up really fast, turned around and screamed at us f**k off, you better f**k off. “I stood my ground and told her to get away from us but she was screaming at the kids saying she hated them, calling them brats and saying she was going to kill us all then she leaned over the babyaposs pram and spat all over her face.” Rachel claims two young boys came over to help and asked the woman to move away and leave Rachel’s children, aged eight, six and five-months, alone however Rachel alleged the woman then attempted to hit them. Rachel, who lives in Rock Ferry, said: “A lady from Rockchesters hair salon came over and took my kids a few metres away. “My friend was working in the community shop over the road and came out to help but this woman was swearing and screaming saying f**k off repeatedly. “The bus came and the driver wouldnapost let her on. She screamed at my friend and flew at her, grabbed her hair and knocked her glasses off into the road. “My friend was hitting her trying to get her off. I was kicking her trying to get her to let go of her hair.” Rachel claims the woman was trying to punch them before a man intervened and literally picked the woman off Rachelaposs friend and escorted her away. Merseyside Police was called to the scene following the alleged attack. It is not yet known whether the woman was arrested. Rachel said her eight-year-old son is still “really upset” by Saturdayaposs incident and has had “nightmares and is really anxious” as a result. She added: “Iaposve been having panic attacks and couldnapost manage to take them to school.” Jade Bosworth witnessed the incident unravel from her living room window and said the woman “shouldn’t be allowed out or around children”.Writing about the post on Facebook, Rachel said she was left “furious” by the incidentThe post received over  comments with many branding the incident “vile” and “disgusting”, while others noted that they had never seen the woman in the area before. One person said: “How vile. I can’t even imagine how I’d be feeling.” And another wrote: “Omg that’s absolutely disgusting! I hope you and your babies are okay!” Comment MORE ON Merseyside PoliceBabies" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: working mcdonalds harder oxbridge degree
story: Working at McDonalds is harder than Oxbridge degree - and my flatmates couldnt wash upEarning minimum wage just to have customers bad-mouthing me was tough... even tougher than working on my Cambridge degree, writes Elizabeth HaighI would get home and quite literally collapse to the floor. Then I would have to get up again because there was housework, A-level coursework, or revision to do Image: Getty ImagesopinionByElizabeth Haigh:,  Nov | commentsWhat would you do for £. an hour  Not a lot, I imagine. Aged  I worked nine-hour shts at McDonald’s for this measly sum, saving towards university while doing a job that is, without a doubt, harder than an Oxbridge degree. And you can trust me: I’ve done both. Shts at McDonald’s are far from a golden time. Spent running around, never sitting down, under constant pressure to deliver meals within the magic -second window, all the time fixing a smile on your face and saying hurried, robotic company mantras: “Enjoy your meal!” Sounds exhausting  It is. Not to mention the frequent abuse, bad-mouthing and often flat-out lies from customers angling for a free Big Mac .  I would get home and quite literally collapse to the floor. Then I would have to get up again because there was housework, A-level coursework, or revision to do. Flash forward a year, and Iaposd just arrived at the University of Cambridge. I come from a low-income, single-parent household from the back of beyond in Shropshire. I was excited, nervous, and finally free. But I was not prepared for the culture shock I was about to experience.  The majority of my new friends were privately educated. Some of them had never had a job at all, let alone a customer service job. As term began, I became increasingly incredulous as I had to advise some of myfriends on everything from how to use a scourer, to how to wash up and cook pasta. And break the news that no, you can’t just add tomato purée to plain pasta and expect it to turn into the delicious vegetable sauce your mother makes. I went from flipping burgers and swearing as the milkshake machine broke again , to attending fancy formals with menus where I barely understood half the words on the page.Cambridge was tough. The workload was overwhelming and, at times, it felt like I was drowning in deadlines. If you turn up to McDonald’s at nine in the morning, or more often, six, there’s no-one interrogating your most recent essay on the philosophical value of th century French literature, asking you questions until you can’t string two words together anymore. But for all its reputation, Cambridge is the very definition of work hard, play hard. I would study for eight hours every day and despair that no matter how much time I spent, it was never enough. But then there were the formals, the balls, the nights out with friends that made it all worth it. My college became my family, and its people my community. McDonald’s is tougher than an Oxbridge degree. It is bone-wearying, relentless, and without any of the fun. But it also taught me to be grateful for every penny I have, and to appreciate the degree that enables me to do what I love. And no Oxbridge degree could have taught me that. title: homeowner who only made one
story: Homeowner who only made one mortgage payment in  years is finally evictedGuramrit Hanspal, , bought the three-bed home in East Meadow, New York, in  and since  its been owned by two banks and a real estate company, though he didnt have to leaveGuramrit Hanspal had lived in the home for  years Image: GoogleByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA man who lived in a house for more than two decades without paying his mortgage has been evicted, it is reported. Guramrit Hanspal had filed four lawsuits and claimed bankruptcy seven times to avoid being evicted from his three-bed home in East Meadow, Long Island, US. The -year-old bought the ,-square-foot property in  and since  when he was foreclosed upon itaposs been owned by two banks and a real estate company, though he didnapost have to leave. He was successfully able to leverage the US Bankruptcy Codeaposs aposautomatic stayapos rules, which temporarily protect debtors from collections, harassment and foreclosures. On Friday Nassau County sherfaposs deputies went to the two-storey home and changed the locks, two months after a judge ruled the occupant was there illegally. The New York Post reports that about half a dozen sherf’s officers turned up just before  am with a locksmith in tow.After knocking on the doors and getting no response, they went in before removal workers worked for three and a half hours taking out all of the contents. It was said to have included a stained sofa, mattresses, box springs, broken-down IKEA shelves, chairs, a stove, a tire and a child’s electric truck. The belongings will now move into storage for  days, Diamond Ridge company lawyer Jordan Katz said. He said it was a aposlong time coming.apos  Max Sold of the firm told the publication: While this is a victory for us and we’re grateful for the ruling issued by Judge Hohauser, in a sense it’s too little too late and the damage has been done. “I am disappointed that this inidual was allowed to lie, cheat, and steal from hardworking taxpayers for greater than  years.” “We’ll be luckywe break even,” said Diamond Ridge owner Jason Epstein, who saw the eviction. He added: “I expected it would take about a year and a half and about , … It took three years and about three times that amount, plus the taxes for three years, which we had to pay.” The company reportedly wants to renovate and repair the house before selling it. It was previously estimated that Hanspal saved at least ,over the years, after purchasing the home on an initial interest rate of . per cent for , . He got the mortgage from Washington Mutual and made one payment of ,. , with the foreclosure proceedings starting a year later, court records show. In January  he filed his first bankruptcy claim, then another in November , two in , and one in . In  he transferred the deed to his friend who then filed for bankruptcy himself in  to continue the cycle. Washington Mutual went under in  and its assets were taken over by JP Morgan Chase - and, unable to get rid of Hanspal, the new bank had been locked in litigation with him for years. title: man who spent 24 years
story: Man who spent  years in jail for murder he didnt commit is finally freedDonate Sharpe was finally freed after spending  years in prison for a crime he did not commit even after a key witness had "entirely made up" her testimonyDontae Sharpe was ly imprisoned for murder and spent years fighting for his freedomByBethan EdwardsKieren Williams:,  Nov | commentsA man who spent  years in jail for a murder he did not commit after a key witness lied has been finally freed. Dontae Sharpe was granted a full pardon by North Caroline Governor Roy Copper, on Friday after decades fighting for his freedom.Sharpe, an African American, was just -years-old when he was sentenced in  for murdering George Radclfe, , during a drug deal.He was convicted based on the evidence given by Charlene Johnson, who was then -year-old and claimed to have seen Sharpe kill Radclfe and described it in detail. However, Johnson recanted her testimony two weeks later and after decades of trying to get his sentence overturned, two evidential hearings in  destroyed the case against Sharpe.  Not only had Johnson withdraw her initial testimony,tried again she would testy that she was not present at the time of the shooting and that her trial testimony was entirely made up based on what she saw on television and what investigators told her. In addition to that, the medical examiner of the trial, Dr Mary Gilliand only learned of Johnsonaposs  testimony well after the trial was over andcalled to a retrial would testy that Johnsonaposs initial description of the shooting was medically and scientically impossible. Sharpe is now eligible to apply for compensation of up to ,after losing decades of his le, , for each year of wrongful imprisonment. Speaking about the case, Cooper said: I have carefully reviewed Dontae Sharpeaposs case and am granting him a Pardon of Innocence. Mr Sharpe and others who have been wrongly convicted deserve to have that injustice fully and publicly acknowledged. Throughout his sentence, Sharpe maintained his innocence and refused to take a lighter sentence in exchange for a guilty plea. After being declared innocent, Sharpe said: Iaposm still in a haze, kind of. When youaposre dealing with us human beings, it can go any way, yes and no. I didnapost know what to expect. I was believing for a pardon. My familyaposs name has been cleared. Itaposs a burden off of my shoulders and my familyaposs shoulders.  Sharpe continues his fight to help others who have been convicted wrongfully. He added: My freedom is still incomplete as long as thereaposs still people going to prison wrongfully,thereaposs still people in prison wrongfully and thereaposs still people that are waiting on pardons. Iaposve been in there and know there are guys that are innocent and know that our system is corrupt and needs to be changed.  This is far from the first time an African American has been convicted of a crime they did not commit. Ronnie Long, , was sentenced to  years in prison for rape and burglary in  but released after spending  years behind bars. He had always maintained his innocence too. Robert McClendon, Ricky Jackson, and Laurese Glover served a total of  years in prison for crimes they didn’t commit.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON MurderPrisonsCrimeBurglaryRacism" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: Woman baffled by bosses response after asking about salary in job interviewIts the question you feel most awkward asking during a job interview, but its vital information that can help you decide whether you will accept a new position or notThe woman was left fuming Image: Getty ImagesByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsNo matter how many job interviews youaposve had, they donapost necessarily get easier. And itaposs fair to say, itaposs never going to be a relaxing situation to be in - as you sit opposite a stranger that you know is making snap judgements of you. Itaposs also important to decide whether you want to work at this place. One woman may have had a lucky escape after her interviewee had a rather odd answer when she inquired how much the salary was.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here In the online interview over Skype, the applicant wrote: Can I at least know your base pay per hour so I know itaposs within my acceptance rate. Naturally, this sparked derision online - with many people pointing out that this is an outdated stereotype that is completely unrealistic. The woman persisted, explaining why she needed to know, as she wrote: Yeah sorry but I need to know how much Iaposm getting because I got bills to pay other interviews to consider. They then sarcastically added: Not saying the base pay is a red flag for me. She shared the post on Reddit, where it racked up hundreds of comments. Like would this person youaposre talking to work a job for less than theyaposre currently getting paid or need to comfortably pay their bills  Of course they would refuse such a job offer put in your exact situation. title: astronauts take refuge iss russian
story: Astronauts take refuge on ISS as Russian missile test scatters debris in spaceThe Russian anti-satellite missile test on Monday generated a debris field in low-Earth orbit that endangered the station and will pose a hazard to space activities for years, say officialsA Nudol surface-to-space missile Image: Ministry of DefenceByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsThe US has slammed Russiaaposs aposdangerous and irresponsible behaviourapos after an anti-satellite missile test forced astronauts on the International Space Station to take refuge. The Russian test carried out on Monday generated a debris field in low-Earth orbit that endangered the station and will pose a hazard to space activities for years, say US officials. The direct-ascent anti-satellite missile fired by Russia into one of its own satellites generated more than , pieces of trackable orbital debris and would likely spawn hundreds of thousands of smaller fragments, the US Space Command said in a statement. Russia has demonstrated a deliberate disregard for the security, safety, stability and long-term sustainability of the space domain for all nations, space command chief US Army General James Dickinson said. The debris from the missile test will continue to pose a threat to activities in outer space for years to come, putting satellites and space missions at risk, as well as forcing more collision avoidance manoeuvres, he said.  US Secretary of State Antony Blinken also condemned the missile test as reckless and irresponsible. The seven-member space station crew - four US astronauts, a German astronaut and two Russian cosmonauts - were told to take shelter in their docked spaceship capsules for two hours after the test as a precaution, NASA said. The research lab, orbiting about  miles above Earth, continued to pass through or near the debris cluster every  minutes, but NASA specialists determined it was safe for the crew toto the stationaposs interior after the third pass, the agency said. The crew was also ordered to seal off hatches to several modules of the International Space Stationfor the time being, according to NASA. NASA will continue monitoring the debris in the coming days and beyond to ensure the safety of our crew in orbit, NASA chief Bill Nelson said in the statement. Experts said the testing of weapons that shatter satellites in orbit pose a space hazard by creating clouds of fragments that can collide with other objects, setting off a chain reaction of projectiles through Earth orbit.A message posted on Twitter by the Russian space agency Roscosmos downplayed the danger.The orbit of the object, which forced the crew today to move into spacecraft according to standard procedures, has moved away from the ISS orbit, Roscosmos tweeted. The station is in the green zone. At the Pentagon, spokesman John Kirby said the test showed the need to firmly establish norms of behaviour in space. It is unthinkable that Russia would endanger not only the American and international partner astronauts on the ISS, but also their own cosmonauts, Nelson said.  He said the cloud of debris also posed a threat to a separate Chinese space station under construction and the three-member crew of taikonauts aboard that outpost. In April Russia carried out another test of an anti-satellite missile as officials have said that space will increasingly become an important domain for warfare. In , India shot down one of its own satellites in low-Earth orbit with a ground-to-space missile.These tests have raised questions about the long-term sustainability of space operations essential to a huge range of commercial activities, from telecommunications and weather forecasting to banking and GPS services.Comment MORE ON NasaInternational Space StationU.S. Space Command" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: kim jong un seen public
story: Kim Jong-un seen in public for first time in a month after rumours about healthNorth Korean state media published photos of Kim Jong-un who was out walking and smiling after rumours that he was unwell after not being seen publicly for over a monthKim Jong-un was pictured for the first time in over a month Image: via REUTERSBySimon HamalienkoSebastian Murphy-BatesTim Hanlon:,  Nov | commentsKim Jong-un has been pictured out visiting a construction project for the first time in over a month after rumours had spread that he was ill. North Korean state media released images of the smiling leader wearing a leather jacket as he inspected sites in Samjiyon.Over the past year Kimaposs public appearances have been few and spread out which have fuelled the talk that he is not well, reported the Daily Star. He was previously seen on October  as he inspected a missile exhibition in Pyongyang, reported state media. Kimaposs family has a history of heart disease and there have been rumours over the years of him having a cardiovascular condition.  But the new images released, give the impression of Kim looking well and full of smiles for the public engagement. The North Korean leader was in Samjiyon to see for his own eyes the third phase of a construction project in the city, said state media. The report says Kim wants to transform Samjiyon into a great standard and ideal model local city.Kimaposs absence from the North Korean media spotlight is reportedly his longest during his time in leadership since , according to the Independent.But North Korean authorities have explained his lack of attendance at public events is down to him working on other important state issues behind the scenes.  All the same there are plenty of questions why the -year-old has taken eight breaks away from public activity, with in the past he has been more regularly photographed at events. Meanwhile the North Korean authorities continue their fighting talk and recently held an artillery shell fire tests designed to annihilate the enemy. The state media reported that the drills come at a time when the enthusiasm to undergo intensive training prevails throughout the Korean Peopleaposs Armyfor ushering in a new heyday in strengthening the state defence capabilities under the banner of self-defence. General Rim Kwang Il, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, and commanders of the participating units watched the drills, but Kim was absent from the event.
